Package stocker.model

Class ChartIndicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • stocker.model.ChartIndicator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChartIndicatorBollingerBands, ChartIndicatorSMA
    public abstract class ChartIndicator
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a technical indicator for a chart. An indicator is described by a list of data candles that the indicator is defined on, the values of the indicator, and a separate list of timestamps at which the candles are given (for more convenience when plotting this indicator to a chart).
    Author:
    Marc S. Schneider
    See Also:
    ChartIndicatorSMA, ChartIndicatorBollingerBands

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ChartIndicator()
      Constructs a new chart indicator without assigning data candles and without setting parameters.
      ChartIndicator​(java.util.LinkedList<Candle> candles)
      Constructs a new chart indicator with data candles assigned, but without the parameters set.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChartIndicator

        public ChartIndicator()
        Constructs a new chart indicator without assigning data candles and without setting parameters. These need to be set later via setParameters(int[]) and setCandles(LinkedList), or (for the parameters) interactively with a dialog via getParametersMessage() and parametrizeFromTextfields().

      • ChartIndicator

        public ChartIndicator​(java.util.LinkedList<Candle> candles)
        Constructs a new chart indicator with data candles assigned, but without the parameters set. The parameters need to be set later via setParameters(int[]), or interactively with a dialog via getParametersMessage() and parametrizeFromTextfields().
        Parameters:
        candles - a LinkedList of candles representing the data that this indicator is defined on

    • Method Detail

      • getAllValues

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double>> getAllValues()
        Returns all values defined by this indicator.
        Returns:
        a LinkedList containing one or several LinkedLists of Double values, one list for each indicator value

      • getValues

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double> getValues​(int i)
        Returns one list of values for one of the indicators defined by this ChartIndicator (e.g. a lower Bollinger band or a simple moving average).
        Parameters:
        i - request the i-th indicator value defined by this ChartIndicator
        Returns:
        the LinkedList of Double values for the indicator at the requested position, or null if there if there are less than i+1 indicators.

      • getValueIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Double> getValueIterator​(int i)
        Get an iterator for the i-th value list defined by this indicator.
        Parameters:
        i - request an iterator for the i-th indicator value defined by this ChartIndicator
        Returns:
        an iterator over the LinkedList of Double values for the indicator at the requested position, or null if there if there are less than i+1 indicators.

      • getTimeIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Long> getTimeIterator()
        Get an iterator for the time stamps at which this indicator is defined.
        Returns:
        an iterator of a LinkedList of Long values, representing the times stamps at which this indicator is defined

      • getNrOfValues

        public int getNrOfValues()
        Get the number of indicator values that are defined by this indicator, i.e. the number of LinkedList that the LinkedList returned by getAllValues() contains.
        Returns:
        the number of indicator values defined by this ChartIndicator

      • setCandles

        public void setCandles​(java.util.LinkedList<Candle> candles)
        Set the data candles that this indicator is defined on. If candles have been set previously, they will be replaced. Changes to the indicator values will only happen after calculate() has been called.
        Parameters:
        candles - a LinkedList of data candles that this chart indicator should be defined on

      • setActive

        public void setActive​(boolean b)
        Set this indicator's activity flag to active (if active, a chart should draw this indicator).
        Parameters:
        b - true to set this indicator active, or false to set it inactive

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Query whether this indicator is set to active.
        Returns:
        true if this indicator is set as active, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this indicator. To be implemented by the subclasses.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this indicator

      • calculate

        public abstract void calculate()
        Calculate this indicator's values based on the parameters and data candles that have previously been set. Values at all time stamps will be calculated. If values had been calculated before, they will be recalculated. To be implemented by the subclasses.

      • getParametersMessage

        public abstract java.lang.Object[] getParametersMessage()
        Get an object array containing Strings and JTextFields from which the parameters can be requested with a JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog. To be implemented by the subclasses.
        Returns:
        an array containing the Strings and JTextFields required to construct a dialog to enter the parameter values

      • parametrizeFromTextfields

        public abstract void parametrizeFromTextfields()
        Determine the parameters from user input in text fields (to be used in conjunction wih getParametersMessage()). Call this method after the parameter selection dialog has been closed / confirmed. To be implemented by the subclasses.

      • getType

        public abstract java.lang.String getType()
        Get a String representing a human-readable name for this type (class) of indicator. To be implemented by the subclasses.
        Returns:
        a String representing a human-readable name for this type (class) of indicator

      • getParameters

        public abstract int[] getParameters()
        Get the parameters of this indicator as an array. This can be used for serialization. To be implemented by the subclasses.
        Returns:
        an array which contains the parameters by which this indicator is defined

      • setParameters

        public abstract void setParameters​(int[] params)
        Set the parameters of this indicator to the values given in the argument. This can be used for deserialization.
        Parameters:
        params - an array of parameters to be set for this indicator

      • getColor

        public EChartColors getColor()
        Returns the color in which the indicator should be drawn.
        Returns:
        the color in which the indicator should be drawn

      • setColor

        public void setColor​(EChartColors c)
        Sets the color in which this indicator should be drawn to the specified color.
        Parameters:
        c - the color in which the indicator should be drawn

      • getColorCombo

        protected javax.swing.JComboBox<EChartColors> getColorCombo()
        Returns a combo box with the available colors, the active one pre-selected
        Returns:
        a combo box with the available colors, the active one pre-selected

      • setColorFromCombo

        protected void setColorFromCombo()
        Sets the active indicator color from the combo (to be called after the combo has been used for a parametrization dialog).

      • addValueList

        protected void addValueList​(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double> valueList)
        Add a list of values to the indicator's value list (one list could be e.g. the lower Bollinger Band).
        Parameters:
        valueList - the list to be added

      • setValuesList

        protected void setValuesList​(int index,
                             java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double> valueList)
        Replace the value list at the given index by the provided new value list.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the list to be replaced
        valueList - the new value list to be set at index

      • setParametrized

        protected void setParametrized​(boolean isParametrized)
        Set this chart indicator as parametrized (to be used by subclasses after all initialization has been done).
        Parameters:
        isParametrized - true to set this indicator parametrized, false to set it un-parametrized

      • isParametrized

        protected boolean isParametrized()
        Returns whether this indicator is parametrized.
        Returns:
        true if parametrized, false otherwise

      • getCandles

        protected java.util.LinkedList<Candle> getCandles()
        Returns the list of data candles that this indicator is based on.
        Returns:
        the list of data candles that this indicator is based on

      • getTimes

        protected java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Long> getTimes()
        Returns the list of times at which this indicator is evaluated.
        Returns:
        the list of times at which this indicator is evaluated
